bugprone-no-escape.description:
Description

Finds pointers with the
noescape
attribute that are captured by an
asynchronously-executed block. The block arguments in
dispatch_async()
and
dispatch_after()
are guaranteed to escape, so it is an error if a pointer
with the
noescape
attribute is captured by one of these blocks.

The following is an example of an invalid use of the
noescape
attribute.

void
foo
(
__attribute__
((
noescape
))
int
*
p
)
{
dispatch_async
(
queue
,
^
{
*
p
=
123
;
});
});
bugprone-no-escape.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
